hunterseekerrobotproject

Class Hunter

  • java.lang.Object
    • hunterseekerrobotproject.Robot
      • hunterseekerrobotproject.Hunter

  • public class Hunter
extends Robot
    This class adds Hunter related fields and methods to the Robot class, enabling the Hunter to measure the Target Position (using a noisy sensor), filter the noisy measurements to estimate the Target's True Position, then plan an intercept path and attempt to capture the Target.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class hunterseekerrobotproject.Robot

        maxdistance

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hunter(java.lang.String newname, double setxpos, double setypos, double setheading, double setcaptol)
      Constructs a Hunter as a Robot with a "capture tolerance" which indicates how close the Hunter must get to the Targets true (not estimated) position in order to capture it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double computeBearing(double[] position)
      Computes the bearing (North of due East) from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
      double computeRange(double[] position)
      Computes the distance between the Hunter and an arbitrary x-y position
      double[] computeRendezvous(double[][] state)
      Plans an intercept path using knowledge of the Target position, velocity, and turning rate returned from the Kalman Filter, as well as knowledge of the Hunters maneuvering limitations.
      boolean hasCaptured()
      Overrides the hasCaptured function to be a simple check on the captured boolean
      void hasCaptured(double[] position)
      Checks to see whether the Hunter is within the capture tolerance of the Target's true position
      void printBearing(double[] position)
      Prints out the bearing from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
      void printRange(double[] position)
      Prints out the distance from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
      void realisticPursue(Target target)
      Pursues the given target using an Extended Kalman Filter to process noisy measurements and an intercept planning algorithm to handle cases where the Hunter is slower than the target.
      void simplePursue(Target target)
      Pursues the given target using an ineffective strategy of aiming straight for the Target's current position, ignoring measurement noise and relative velocity.
      void testMatrixClass()
      Tests all of the methods of the Matrix class to ensure proper Matrix math implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hunter

        public Hunter(java.lang.String newname,
              double setxpos,
              double setypos,
              double setheading,
              double setcaptol)
        Constructs a Hunter as a Robot with a "capture tolerance" which indicates how close the Hunter must get to the Targets true (not estimated) position in order to capture it.
        Parameters:
        newname - The Name of the Hunter
        setxpos - The initial x-position of the Hunter
        setypos - The initial y-position of the Hunter
        setheading - The initial heading of the Hunter
        setcaptol - The "capture tolerance", how close the Hunter must get to capture the Target

    • Method Detail

      • hasCaptured

        public void hasCaptured(double[] position)
        Checks to see whether the Hunter is within the capture tolerance of the Target's true position
        Parameters:
        position - the true position of the Target for comparison

      • hasCaptured

        public boolean hasCaptured()
        Overrides the hasCaptured function to be a simple check on the captured boolean
        Returns:
        true if within the capture tolerance of the target, false otherwise

      • computeRange

        public double computeRange(double[] position)
        Computes the distance between the Hunter and an arbitrary x-y position
        Parameters:
        position - an array containing the x-y position of interest in the first two indices
        Returns:
        the straight line distance between the hunter and x-y position in dimensionless coordinates

      • computeBearing

        public double computeBearing(double[] position)
        Computes the bearing (North of due East) from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
        Parameters:
        position - an array containing the x-y position of interest in the first two indices
        Returns:
        the bearing from the hunter to the position in Radians North of due east

      • printRange

        public void printRange(double[] position)
        Prints out the distance from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
        Parameters:
        position - an array containing the x-y position of interest in the first two indices

      • printBearing

        public void printBearing(double[] position)
        Prints out the bearing from the Hunter to an arbitrary x-y position
        Parameters:
        position - an array containing the x-y position of interest in the first two indices

      • simplePursue

        public void simplePursue(Target target)
        Pursues the given target using an ineffective strategy of aiming straight for the Target's current position, ignoring measurement noise and relative velocity.
        Parameters:
        target - the Robot to pursue

      • realisticPursue

        public void realisticPursue(Target target)
        Pursues the given target using an Extended Kalman Filter to process noisy measurements and an intercept planning algorithm to handle cases where the Hunter is slower than the target.
        Parameters:
        target - the Robot to pursue

      • computeRendezvous

        public double[] computeRendezvous(double[][] state)
        Plans an intercept path using knowledge of the Target position, velocity, and turning rate returned from the Kalman Filter, as well as knowledge of the Hunters maneuvering limitations.
        Parameters:
        state - the full 5 degree of freedom state of the target as returned from the Kalman Filter
        Returns:
        an array containing the x-y coordinates for the *current* best position for intercept

      • testMatrixClass

        public void testMatrixClass()
        Tests all of the methods of the Matrix class to ensure proper Matrix math implementation.
